alert.note: Alert for Chase (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 11:08AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Chase and northern Greenwood Counties through NOON CDT... At 1108 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Madison to 12 miles west of Olpe. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Madison, Hamilton, Virgil and Thrall. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 107 and 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for southeastern and east central Kansas.
